t: Return,*pn O Israel, to the Lord*s your God, For*ln you have stumbled because of your iniquity.
Take*ln words with you and return to the Lord.*s Say*ln to Him, “Take away all iniquity And*ln receive us*i graciously, That*ln we may present the fruit of our lips.
Assyria*ln will not save us, We*ln will not ride on horses; Nor*ln will we say again, ‘Our god,’ To*ln the work of our hands; For*ln in You the orphan finds mercy.”
I*ln will heal their apostasy, I*ln will love them freely, For*ln My anger has turned away from them.
I*ln will be like the dew to Israel; He*ln will blossom like the lily, And*ln he will take root like the*i cedars*i of*i Lebanon.
His*ln shoots will sprout, And*ln his beauty will be like the olive tree And*ln his fragrance like the*i cedars*i of*i Lebanon.
Those*ln who live in his shadow Will*ln again raise grain, And*ln they will blossom like the vine. His*ln renown will*i be*i like the wine of Lebanon.
O*ln Ephraim, what more have I to do with idols? It*ln is I who answer and look after you. I*ln am like a luxuriant cypress; From*ln Me comes your fruit.

Whoever*ln is wise, let him understand these things; Whoever*iln is discerning, let him know them. For*ln the ways of the Lord*s are right, And*ln the righteous will walk in them, But*ln transgressors will stumble in them.
